conversations.content: *sigh* This heat is nigh on unbearable...
It's no wonder I went so long without visiting the beach.
We sylvans are rather weak to the sun, after all...
It's swimmin' tiiiiime!
WHAT'S UP, OCEAN?!
...Some of us, at least.
Yo Cleo, come say hi to the ocean!
I think the ocean can hear me from here. Besides, it's far too hot to leave the shade of my umbrella.
That's what the water's for, dummy!
Have your fun, Luca. Don't trouble yourself over me.
Eh, suit yourself. Yo Ranzal, you ready?!
COWABUNGA, BRO!
*sigh* Where do they find the energy?
The only way to beat this heat is to hide from it completely.
Or...is that merely what I want to believe?
I spent so long crafting these hair accessories, only to waste away the hours like this...
Cleo? Aren't you going to join the others?
I-I took it upon myself to watch over things, in case any emergencies arise.
That, and I'm still not entirely comfortable in this swimsuit...
What was that last part?
N-nothing!
Please, go and have fun with the others. I am content to chaperon.
How about we take turns, then?
It wouldn't be right if you just ended up watching us the whole time.
Is that not the role of a retainer?
There's no rule that says retainers aren't allowed to enjoy themselves at the beach.
Perhaps not, but my duty to you takes precedent over seaside frolics.
Isn't it also my duty as prince to take care of my people?
I appreciate your concern, Highness, but I am quite capable of handling this alone.
I much prefer the shelter of my umbrella, in any event.
Now go! Enjoy yourself.
Right. Well, would you mind if I sat beside you then?
Hm? Whyever for?
I'd like to keep you company.
B-but... Surely there is more fun to be had splashing in the sea.
We likely won't be back here soon; you should enjoy it while you can.
That's exactly why I don't want to leave you sitting here alone.
If I'm intruding, though, I'll leave you be.
...You really are too kind for your own good, you know.
I just want you to have fun like everyone else.
That is precisely what I'm referring to.
*sigh* Very well. I concede defeat.
Defeat? What do you mean?
I shall join the others in the water.
I won't be responsible for you missing your own chance at fun.
But...didn't you just say you preferred the shade?
Do you want to splash around together or not?
Y-yes, yes I do!
Right then.
You want me to enjoy myself...
And I wish you the same.
Then what are we waiting for? Let's get out there and make the most of it!
Try not to get TOO carried away.
...Heh. I suddenly feel I might be able to endure this heat.
The sea truly is beautiful.
It seems to only grow more so each time I see it.
Yeah. It never gets old, does it?
Still, we've done nothing but walk along the beach so far.
Isn't there anything else you want to do while we're here?
Oh, are you bored?
We can do whatever you like.
Er, well, I want today to be about YOU.
You do so much to keep things running smoothly at the castle.
So I'd really like you to have fun today doing whatever you like.
Well, then I believe we have a problem.
W-we do?
Indeed.
You see, I am more than happy simply doing whatever YOU want to do.
So your asking me to choose something myself is...difficult. I don't really have any ideas.
I see...
I guess one of us will just have to pick something then.
Hmm... Wait, isn't that Julietta?
It certainly is—and I believe she's building a sand sculpture of Elisanne.
No, no, NO!
Elly is FAR more beautiful than this. But what am I missing...?
Ugh, I was doomed from the start. As if I could ever replicate her form with my own hands... Fie, the hubris!
This work is a failure. It must be erased from existence!
Julietta, wait!
It would be a terrible waste to destroy such a wonderful work of art.
Wh-what are you two doing here?
We were just on a walk, and saw you down the beach.
That's meant to be Elisanne, yes?
You've captured her perfectly.
You really think... I-I mean, of course I did! As if I would ever produce anything less than perfection.
You did a great job. I'm sure Elisanne would be honored to see it.
She would?
Oh, Julietta, it's wonderful! YOU'RE wonderful!
You've introduced me to a new plane of happiness—how can I ever repay you?
...I have to show her.
If it can make her THAT happy, I have to show her at once!
I'M COMING, ELLY!
Look at her go...
Nothing breeds confidence like praise.
And she deserves it. The expression, the armor... She really did capture Elisanne with shocking detail.
Hey, how about we make our own sand sculptures?
That is a cruel joke, Your Highness.
You know very well how I fare in the fine arts.
Er, sorry.
I just figured you might be interested in trying, given how intently you were staring at that sculpture.
...Very well.
Let's...try.
That's the spirit! We might not reach Julietta's level, but we can at least do our best.
Mine's finally starting to look like a castle! How're you doing, Cleo?
A-avert your eyes!
Er, why are you hiding your sculpture?
Because... Because it's still under construction!
What are you making? It's pretty big already.
...By some wretched twist of fate, I, too, am building a castle.
I was already displeased with my work, but comparing it to yours has only shown me how pitiful my creation truly is.
You shouldn't be ashamed of your work.
Making sand sculptures is all about the fun you have doing it; the quality of the finished product doesn't really matter, in the end.
...I suppose you have a point.
I should focus more on enjoying the process.
Exactly! So let's finish strong, and—
Oh no, the tide!
My castle... It's... It's gone...
And I was nearly done!
You do realize you preside over an ACTUAL castle, yes? Besides, it's not as if the sand itself is gone. You can begin anew.
...Actually, I have a favor to ask, Your Highness.
Oh? What is it?
Could we make a castle together this time?
I think I could learn much from working alongside you.
That's a great idea. We'll build a bigger and better castle from the ground up, together! Shall we?
Yes!
Was that your stomach, Euden?
Er, sorry. I didn't realize I was so hungry.
Well, it IS lunchtime. I could use some food myself.
That hut appears to serve foods. Shall we go see what they offer?
Oh my! I wasn't expecting such a crowd.
Me neither. ...Huh?
Thanks for waiting. Next please!
Hey, I been waitin' ages here! Where's my order?!
J-just a moment, sir!
The line just keeps growing... I can't keep up on my own!
If I just had a couple more sets of hands, I'd be golden.
Uh... Nina? Is that you?
Well, if it isn't my favorite customer! What brings you to—
Wait a second Nina, now's not the time for glad-handing!
Excuse me, could I please have some tropical punch?
Comin' right up!
Looks like you're stretched a bit thin. Do you want a hand?
R-REALLY?! ...Can you cook?
Leave the cooking to me.
Well all righty. That means you're on customer service with me, Prince!
Here's your steamed fish medley!
Whew... Restaurant work is no joke.
Waaaaah!
What was that?
Mommyyyyy!
Don't cry. I'll help you find her.
*sniff* Waaaaah!
He won't stop... What should I do?
What's going on, Estelle?
Euden?! What are you doing here?
I've been helping Nina out at the restaurant.
Wait, really? Did you happen to see this boy's mother?
It seems they've been separated.
Hmm... I didn't see anyone looking for a lost child, at least.
I see.
WAAAAAAAH!
If I could just get him to stop crying, I'd ask him what his mother looks like— but I can't even manage that much.
I'm honestly at a bit of a loss here.
Hmm... Wait, I have an idea!
Here you are. One summer parfait.
Holy moly, this looks good as HECK!
...Wow. I just...wow. That's all it took?
Children love sweets; it's one of life's few constants.
And besides, good food always brings a smile.
Ohmigosh, this is SO. GOOD!
Thank you, Cleo. He might actually talk to me now.
THERE you are! I've been looking everywhere for you!
Mommy, look! The nice lady made me this super tasty parfait!
Oh my! Thank you all so much.
We're just happy you two were reunited.
I'm glad everything worked out.
Me too; thank you both for your help. Now, I have to get back to my rounds.
We should return to our duties as well. Business doesn't seem to have slowed in the slightest.
Next plea—oh! Hey, Celliera.
Well, if it isn't Euden! Helping out, are you?
That's right.
Good for you! Customer service is great endurance training—though not everyone survives it.
I commend you putting your life on the line for the sake of your training!
Er, thanks. Anyway, what can I get you?
There's only one thing worth drinking after a rigorous training session, and that's a fresh algae slime and liver shake!
Ha ha! ...Wait, is that a real thing!
Oh, is it ever.
You mix some slime with a few medicinal herbs, a nice chunk of liver, and a few other bits and bobs, and voila—one big, gloopy nutrition drink!
That sounds like eating death.
The healthiest things often do. One must simply consider it part of their training!
Well, either way, I'm pretty sure we don't have that on the menu...
I can make it.
Wait, you can?
I have all the ingredients here, so I don't see why not. Just a moment.
Here you are.
YES! Now for a taste test...
Wow, Cleo. You may have just set a new standard for nutrition drinks. It's so delightfully gloopy!
Here, try some, Euden.
I-I'm actually okay, thanks.
*sniff* *sniff* What's that? Do I smell a quitter?
*sigh* All right, all right—but just a bit. ...Wow, this actually isn't half bad.
But of course. I've made better meals with less.
Heh. You never cease to amaze me, Cleo.
Whew! I think we can finally take a breather.
Guys, seriously, thank you SO much for your help. I would've been eaten alive without you.
I think Cleo took the brunt of it.
Not at all. You were equally busy, if not more so.
...Right. Didn't we come here originally because we were hungry? I totally forgot.
That's no surprise. We've barely had a moment to breathe.
After all you've done, the least I can do is feed you. On the house, of course!
I would be happy to help with the cooking.
No, you rest. I'm not about to make you cook your own thank-you meal!
By the way, that swimsuit of yours was a real hit with the customers, Cleo.
P-pardon?!
Why else do you think we stayed so busy? Hee hee!
I did notice a spike in customers after we started helping...
I-I refuse to believe I had any part in that. It was purely coincidence.
I wouldn't be so sure.
At the very least, everyone seemed to really enjoy the food you were serving.
I can't speak to how your outfit affected the customer count, but it definitely didn't affect your talent as a chef.
Of course not. My abilities could never be hindered by something so trivial.
Now, I believe we can put this topic to rest.
Actually, I did hear one customer say the cook in the swimsuit was cute. They had a point, too.
What?!
...Can I take that to mean you're of the same opinion?
Oh, that swimsuit is definitely cute. No doubt.
Here you go! ...What's up, Cleo? You're red as a beet.
I-I'm merely hungry! Now let's eat!
Nina's cooking was truly delightful.
Seriously! That was some of the best fish I've ever had.
Well, we are by the sea. Food does tend to taste best when it's fresh.
So, now that we're fed, what shall we do next?
Why don't we get in the water? It's not often we have the chance.
So long as you don't expect me to match the energy Luca and Ranzal displayed earlier, I'm not opposed.
Ha ha, not at all. I was kind of just hoping to splash around in the shallows.
Certainly, then.
All right, let's go!
Careful not to slip. Mmm... The water feels quite nice on my feet.
I should be all right wading to my waist...
Cleo! Look out!
Hm?
Ah!
Are you all right?
Surprised by a wave, of all things... I apologize for any worry I caused.
Still, I suppose moments like this are part of what makes the sea such an enjoyable destination.
Sure, as long as nobody gets hurt... Wait, where's your other accessory?
Hm? You're right. That wave must have carried it away.
Oh well, there's no getting it back now.
I'm going to go look for it. It might still be nearby.
Wait, underwater?! Please, it's not worth it!
I'll be back soon!
Wait!
It's all right, Euden. What's done is done.
I can't give up yet. It may have washed up on the shore somewhere.
You've been searching for hours to no avail. It's clearly been lost to the sea.
So please, just let it go.
Please, let me keep searching. Just a bit longer.
Why are you so desperate to find it?
You made those accessories especially for today, right?
...How did you know?
I happened to pass your room while you were making them.
You were so focused, you didn't notice me.
So knowing how much work and care you put in, I can't just accept that it's gone.
So that is what's behind this...
I know I can find it—I just have to keep looking.
I shall say it again: You really are too kind for your own good.
And stubborn to a fault, as well.
Wait, am I really?
Were you not aware?
...Still, I'm your retainer, and your friend.
If you're refusing to give up, I can't stop trying either.
So I, too, shall search a while longer.
Heh. Thanks, Cleo. ...Wait, look!
Ah! Where did you find it?!
It was drifting this way on the waves. I'm so glad we found it!
And just as we steeled our resolve, no less. What a curious coincidence.
Here. I think the other one was lonely.
Indeed. I did feel somehow...off with only one of the pair.
Thank you for finding it. ...Ah!
It's so bright all of a sudden... Euden, look at the water!
Wow... What a beautiful sunset. It's almost like the sun is sinking.
I was so focused on searching, I had no idea it was already so low.
Nor did I. It's almost as if the sky has been streaked with watercolors.
Sunsets here look quite different than they do in the Mistholt.
Yeah. It's one of the most dazzling lights I've ever seen.
Heh. That reminds me of a certain someone.
Huh? Who do you mean?
Who indeed? At the very least, we certainly wouldn't want that person to disappear like the sun does each day.
In any event, it was merely a passing comment.
You realize you're only making me more curious, right?
I'm sure I am.
Truly, though, I want to thank you. I never expected you would spend so much time searching on my behalf.
It's the least I could do for a friend.
We should probably head back, though. It's going to be dark soon.
Yes. Let us return to the others.
...We won't let you disappear. Not so long as we fight alongside you.
Your light is our source of hope.
Ah, there you are.
I was wondering where you'd disappeared to.
Sorry, I just had to hear the waves one more time before heading home.
It's sad to think we likely won't be back here again anytime soon.
Anyway, did you need me for something?
I came to give you this. It's tropical fruit juice, fresh squeezed.
Nina taught me how to make it.
It's made from fruits local to this area.
Oh, wow! Let me give it a try.
Mmm... It's sweet, but also a bit tangy? I think I could drink this all day.
I'm glad you enjoyed it.
Er, sorry I drank so much.
Would you like some more? I have plenty.
Yes, please!
You're finished already?
I sort of...drank it all at once...
Well, you clearly like it. Hold on a moment.
Here you are. This should last you a while longer, at least.
Wait, a whole bottle?! Are you sure there's enough left for everyone else?
Oh, they have more than enough.
I made you a separate batch to begin with.
Really? Why?
To thank you for coaxing me out from under my umbrella.
I had a splendid day, all thanks to you.
There's no need to thank me. I had a lot of fun too.
Oh, but there is. Without your company, I would have done naught but stare at the sea till day's end.
All the while telling myself it was due to the heat, or my duty as a retainer...
But the truth, in fact, is that I wished to enjoy myself as much as the others.
Then all those things you said earlier...
Nothing more than thinly veiled lies, yes.
I wanted to throw my cares away, but the thought of actually doing so froze me solid. Which is ironic, given the heat.
I made those excuses to avoid facing my fear.
I see...
When you spend so much of your life not doing something, it can be hard to embrace it so suddenly.
I just couldn't imagine myself frolicking on the beach, I suppose.
Well, you HAVE been in the forest a long time. I can see how that would be hard.
I'm very glad I was able to overcome that unease.
And I would never have done so without you.
Thank you. Truly.
All that matters to me is that you enjoyed yourself.
But I'd forgotten just how quickly a day can speed by when you leave your worries behind.
I feel sad that it's almost time to leave.
...Would you mind if I joined you?
I would like to listen to the waves as well.
By all means.
What a peaceful night.
The twinkle of the stars in the water is dazzling.
A fitting end to such a dream of a day.
A dream, huh?
I see what you mean; once we return to the Halidom, our fight will begin anew.
I am afraid there are still many battles yet to be fought.
But I believe the memories we made today will fuel our efforts.
Cleo—let's come back here again someday.
That's a pretty thought, Your Highness, but I doubt we'll have the luxury.
We will, once peace has been restored to this land.
And that means next time, we'll have even MORE fun!
Today is more than a dream. It's the very future we're fighting for!
Heh. How very like you.
There aren't many who can speak with such sincerity about their goals.
And I shall do all in my power to see you realize them.
Perhaps then we can add to these seaside memories each year.
Then it's a promise.
Let's come back here and have fun again one day!
Yes. Let's.
